question:
Girl: Is Sam …………. Than you now?
Boy: Yes, He’s grown a lot recently.

Man: Do you ………….. an apple?
Woman: Yes, please.

Man: Did you like Paul's wife?
Woman: Yes, I thought she was …….. nice.

Woman: ………….. do you do?
Man: I'm a teacher at a French school.

Woman: What are you looking for?
Man: My keys. I can't find ………… anywhere.

Man: How ……….. does the train to New York take?
Woman: Around five hours.

Man: Are ……… any bananas on the table?
Woman: I'm sorry. I ate the last one.

Woman: What is your brother's name?
Man: ……… name is Peter.

Woman: How is your mother doing?
Man: She's feeling much better. Thanks.
What does the man mean?
options: A. His mother isn't sick anymore.
B. He doesn't see his mother very often.
C. His mother still doesn't feel very well.
answer: A. His mother isn't sick anymore.

question:
Man: I'm moving to London next month.
Woman: I'm sorry to hear that.
What does the woman mean?
options: A. She didn't hear what the man said.
B. She doesn't want the man to move.
C. She doesn't know why the man is moving.
answer: B. She doesn't want the man to move.

question:
Man: Good morning. I'd like to get a ticket to New York.
Woman: Of course. When would you like to fly?
What does the woman mean?
options: A. What time do you want to leave?
B. How long will you be on the airplane?
C. When are you coming back from New York?
answer: A. What time do you want to leave?

question:
Woman: I'm sorry. I forgot to wash the dishes this morning
Man: It's okay. I did them when I got home.
What does the man mean?
options: A. He can't do the dishes later.
B. He wants the woman to wash the dishes.
C. The woman doesn't need to wash the dishes.
answer: C. The woman doesn't need to wash the dishes.

question:
Waiter: May I take your order?
Customer: Do you have soup today?
Waiter: Let me check. I'll be right back.
What does the waiter mean by her SECOND comment?
options: A. Please wait, I will find out
B. I'm sorry. There's no soup on the menu.
C. Please come with me. You can pay now.
answer: A. Please wait, I will find out

question:
Woman: Do you want to walk to John's house?
Man: Oh, it's not close enough for that!
Woman: Okay, I'll drive us.
What does the man mean?
options: A. He does not know where John's house is.
B. He does not want to walk to John's house.
C. He wants to ask John to come to his house.
answer: B. He does not want to walk to John's house.

question:
Man: Excuse me. Do you know what time it is?
Woman: I'm sorry, I don't have a watch.
What does the woman mean?
options: A. I don't know the time.
C. I can't see the clock from here.
answer: A. I don't know the time.

question:
Man: Can I walk to the supermarket from here?
Woman: It's very far, but the bus stop is here.
What does the woman mean?
options: A. The bus stop is too far.
C. You can take the bus.
answer: C. You can take the bus.

question:
Man: What time do you finish work today?
Woman: I work from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
What does the woman mean?
options: B. She begins work at 2 p.m.
C. She finishes work at 10 a.m.

question:
Woman: Does Mrs. Smith ……….. math?
Man: Yes, she does.

Woman: What’s the weather like outside?
Man: I think it …………. raining.

Man: Would you like some more chicken?
Woman: I’m full. Thanks, anyway.
What does the woman mean?
options: A. There is no more chicken.
B. She does not like chicken.
C. She cannot eat any more chicken.
answer: C. She cannot eat any more chicken.

question:
Woman: Is your sister ………. television?
Man: No, she is not.

Woman: I always like to see snow in the winter.
Man: So ……… I.

Man: Where is my book?
Woman: Here it is.
What does the man mean?

Woman: Do you ……. a drink?
Man: No, thanks.

Man: How is the cake?
Woman: It’s great.
What does the woman mean?

Customer: I really like this bicycle.
Salesman: Yes, it’s the …….. popular bicycle in our store.

Woman: I’ll make you a sandwich for lunch.
Girl: No thanks. I just ate.
What does the girl mean?

Woman: Where are you going for summer vacation?
Man: Definitely somewhere away from here. I can’t stand the heat.
What does the man mean?
options: A. He prefers staying at home this time.
B. He always goes to the same place for vacation.
C. He wants to travel to a place with cool weather.
answer: C. He wants to travel to a place with cool weather.

question:
Man: Do you get along with your sister?
Woman: Yes, I do.
What does the man mean?
options: A. Do you travel to work with your sister?
B. Do you like to spend time with your sister?
C. Do you live in the same place as your sister?
answer: B. Do you like to spend time with your sister?

question:
Man: That concert last night was terrific.
Woman: It was. Did you get to sit up front?
Man: I’d hoped to but I got there too late.
What does the man mean by his SECOND comment?
options: A. I couldn’t sit where I wanted.
B. I didn’t see the end of the concert.
C. I wish I could see the concert again.
answer: A. I couldn’t sit where I wanted.
